Posts.Content: Yes, report any new findings to your doctor. Ask again about the lump you still have, absolutely get a second opinion if your questions are not answered. It's your health and you have every right to have an answer and resolution. Let us know how you are, take care.
Posts.Title: nipple discharge, should I be worried?

Posts.Content: So glad everything turned out well.
Posts.Title: Worried

Posts.Content: Any change in our breasts should be checked out. Since hydrocortizone cream and anti-fungal creams haven't worked, this may be an infection and you need antibiotics. I once had a doctor tell me (I went in to have an area of concerned looked at), that if more women came in when they first noticed something, there would be alot less BC deaths. Make an appointment with your GYN.
Posts.Title: Red Spot somewhat concerned about IBC

Posts.Content: Hi, Request an MRI. Remember, you are your own health advocate. Please keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Large Breast Lump, but negative mammogram and ultrasound

Posts.Content: So glad you called and were seen earlier. Hope the new cream does the trick.
Posts.Title: Red Spot somewhat concerned about IBC

Posts.Content: Please get yourself to an ER and get checked out ASAP.
Posts.Title: 20 year old, hard mass and jelly bean size lump

Posts.Content: Hi, Go back to the doctor, the lump should be evaluated. They should do imaging studies/ ultrasounds to determine if it is of concern.
Posts.Title: Male with a lump in breast
